page.title: 10LIFE STYLES IN FROXFIELD
page.content: Life in this picturesque village has changed little over the past fifty years. Agriculture is the major landcover, and only changes in land usage have been significant. The land was originally owned by Squire William Nicholson, but was divided up in 1945. Before him it had been owned by the Sylvester family since the time of Henry VII. Mechanisation created rural unemployment, so commuters have come to live in Froxfield Green. Farm labourers used to live, and die, in the service of the landowner. Attitudes have also changed though politically it has remained staunchly Conservative. The village green used to have a village shop but this closed recently. It is an area which has not changed for many years.
